page.title: 08RELIGION:CHURCH BELLS.
page.content: The bells at Saint Hilda's church Bilsdale are 650 years old and there are two of them. Saint Hilda's bells were made by Mr Walters of Lund near Malton.The bells were made in Saint Hilda's church yard.There are two bells. Written on the bells is Ave Maria Mater which means , Greetings Mary Mother.The bells are made of bell metal which is mainly copper and tin .The bells were last rung in 1983 by Mr M Richardson .The bells are now at Taylors of Loughbrough being refurbished after all the wear that they have had over the years . When the bells come back they will be blessed by the Bishop of Whitby and then re-hung by Mr. David Wray a builder who lives in Chopgate and who repaired the collapsed church roof in 1985.
